intro: Montanoa tomentosa subsp. xanthiifolia, commonly known as the yellow-leaf montanoa, is a herbaceous perennial native to Mexico. It features a compact growth habit with hairy, grayish-green foliage. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a soft, velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or borders.
